name: Search activity
tagline: The Search Activity app for built by David Veuve to provide visibility into the usage patterns and adoption of Splunk environments.
body:
### Welcome to the Search Activity App for Splunk
The Search Activity app (SA) was written to help Splunk champions understand and grow Splunk usage in their organizations, and to better gauge the activities and personas of their users. It provides metrics on use, organizational information, and adoption. It is designed to allow you to answer all manner of Splunk questions, such as: 
* "What users are running searches?” 
* “Who is running realtime searches?” 
* “How complex are my users grasp of the search language?” 
* “How many errors do they receive?” 
* “How long does it take them to run a search, and over what timeframe?”
* “Who is exporting or sharing search results?”. 

To provide answers, this app features an accelerated data store, 65+ reports, 9 dashboards, alerting capabilities and more. It is modeled and beta tested in a five terabyte, 400+ user environment, but designed to make all Splunk environments more successful, and help all companies get more value.

### Documentation
For access to the latest and greatest documentation, browse to the [automatic help](http://www.davidveuve.com/search_activity/help.html) or [documentation](https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2632/#/documentation)

### Support Requests
Facing issues? Sorry to hear that! File a [support request](http://www.davidveuve.com/search_activity/submit_support.html).

### Releases
See old releases on [github](https://github.com/dveuve/search_activity/releases), or download the latest from [Splunkbase](https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2632)

### Dev Train
Want the latest and greatest? Check out the [dev branch](https://github.com/dveuve/search_activity/tree/dev). Keep in mind that this may be totally broken for long periods of time..
